Project Manager at GovernmentCIO

Remote

Job Locations: US-Remote

Job ID: 2018-1450

# of Openings: 1

Category: Information Technology

Overview

GovernmentCIO is looking for a Project Manager to join our team at the VA FSC in Austin. This role will assist the Project Manager in daily activities and project planning.

Responsibilities

  • Coordinate internal resources and third parties/vendors for the flawless execution of projects
  • Ensure that all projects are delivered on-time, within scope and within budget
  • Developing project scopes and objectives, involving all relevant stakeholders and ensuring technical feasibility
  • Ensure resource availability and allocation
  • Develop a detailed project plan to track progress

Qualifications

  • Proven working experience as a project administrator
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
  • Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills
  • Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office

items.content:
Community Programs Associate

Various
Anywhere in Europe
Company: Elastic
Full Time

Overview

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. The Elastic family unites employees across 32 countries into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

For all of us at Elastic, community matters. Our users and contributors have helped to ensure that Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats are more than just code — they are open source projects that people love to use, and love to talk about! As our Community Programs Associate you will champion our Elastic community.

Are you that kind of person who is invigorated by sharing juicy technology goodness with the world and supporting the tech community? Do you feel at home planing meetups and developer conference appearances by identifying, crafting, and coordinating requirements; establishing contacts; developing schedules and assignments; and coordinating mailing lists? Is implementing community programs and planning community user group events, your jam? Well, this might just be your dream job. In this role, you will wake up each morning ready to fight the good fight and support the advocacy of Elastic’s product line through organizing events, sending promotional materials inventory, executing tradeshow strategy (with support from others) and other exciting challenges as required.

You will have your ear to the ground, monitoring social media for interesting mentions of Elastic and our product lines, while recommending and sharing content. You will do this while traveling the world (up to 30%), and attending events in support of our company goals. User group meetings typically take place in the evenings, thus it is essential that you would be available to attend or be able to remotely coordinate evening events on an as-needed basis. Representing Elastic.

The role is perfect for someone looking to grow their career into as a Community Programs role, or an events/content marketing role.

 and requires being comfortable working from your home. Alternatively, if you prefer offices, we recommend your location be Amsterdam, Paris, Berlin, Munich, or London.

This role is located in Europe

Well, if you read this far and think, “that’s me!” then you probably won’t need to read any further and we should have a conversation. But if you are in any doubt the type of experiences we expect you to have then the following should help clarify;

What You Will Be Doing:
  • Organize and coordinate regional community events
  • Attend local events for market research purposes, with the ability to travel
  • Coordinate the sending of promotional materials and goods to community groups and members, developer conferences, and to support other community programs initiatives
  • Draft basic marketing collateral, such as flyers, blog posts, for events
  • Gain knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading trade publications
  • Effectively and comfortably communicate with many different people in many different roles across a distributed company and community
  • Organize goals by accepting ownership for new and different requests; explore opportunities to contribute to job accomplishments
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills

    • What You Bring Along:

    You have an enthusiasm for planning and executing events, managing programs, and creating marketing collaterol specific to those programs.

    You’d be very motivated to know that you are an integral part of supporting our community of users and helping Elastic be relevant and helpful in what developers globally and across all industries are trying to achieve with our technology.

    You are great at:

    • Project management
    • Event coordination
    • Reporting research results
    • Process improvement
    • Initiative planning
    • Spoken and written English (resumes and cover letters need to be in English, please, since it’s our global company language)
    • Being passionate about what you do

      • Bonus Points:
      • Some experience with community management, programming, open source software, or developer evangelism is very much preferred
      • Familiarity with other SEMEA languages

        • Additional Information:
        • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
        • Stock options
        • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid parental leave (moms and dads)
        • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
        • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
        • Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
        • Distributed-first company with Elasticians in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages!

          • #LI-KE1

          Target locations: Munich, Germany; Berlin, Germany; Paris, France; Amsterdam, The Netherlands

          Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

          To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/elastic/jobs/1272159 →

items.title: Technical Project Manager-Remote position
items.content:
Job Description

REMOTE POSITION

Job Description

  • Resource will need to be able to project manage the complete refresh of an entire site in 3 to 6 months.
  • We are looking for someone that can demonstrate experience working with distributed, remote teams across several areas of technology and can demonstrate how they successfully integrated those tasks across the 5 technology areas (circuits, networks, AV, Voice and Deskside support) into the compressed schedule to meet the timelines driven by the customer.
  • Experience with as many technology towers as possible a must.
  • Support working with deskside support and coordination office moves / installations a must.
  • This individual is working on large office move / campus consolidation projects for a large global organization. Relevant experience is a must.
  • In general, we are looking for the TPM candidate to have experience in managing projects similar to data center migrations or new office technology infrastructure. This candidate would have experience managing ALL aspects of technology associated with an office consolidation, decommission, upgrade or new build. This would include some level of experience with all of the following: voice, AV, network, end user devices, servers. The ideal candidate will be a project management professional experienced in all technical aspects of applications and server migrations, comfortable leading geographically dispersed technical resources and communicating with program and organizational leadership.
  • Experience with data center or office (technology only) type consolidation, relocation, decommission and brand new locations.
  • Experience working with matrixed resource teams.
  • Organizes various sources of data into coherent plan to deliver migration, including schedule, resource plan, budget and entry risks and mitigation.
  • Oversees and coordinates analysts and technical resources - both onshore and offshore - including ) to deliver migrations on time and on budget.
  • Delivery focused role, involving migration planning, prioritization of tasks and resolution of issues to deliver per the corporate property schedule.
  • Maintains oversight of the migration team, ensuring consistency and quality across planning artefacts and key outputs.
  • Identifies risks and issues, works to develop effective resolution plans, and escalates in a timely manner for needed program and organizational leadership help.
  • Works with Application Owners and Support Teams to effectively plan and execute migration through: upfront planning, scheduling, design, testing and migration.
  • Coordinates resource allocations across the team.
  • Coordination of third party resources involved across migration teams.
  • Effectively communicates, verbally and in written form, project status, risks and issues.
  • Strong project management skills.
  • Ability to manage and prioritize among competing priorities
  • Effectively communicates across various levels of individual project contributors, project and program leadership, and organization leadership
  • Application migration experience across a complex application and organization environment is preferred
  • IT infrastructure and IT applications experience
  • Strong client facing and relationship building skills are required as the role will involve interaction with Application Owners, Business Teams and Technical Operations leaders
  • Capable of delivering unfavorable news
  • Flexibility and capability to work across multiple timezones
  • Experience in managing large scale projects in enterprise data centers, including application and server migrations
  • General knowledge across data center technical disciplines, including network, storage, virtualization, and capacity management
  • Familiarity with Smartsheets as a Project Planning and Scheduling tool
  • Experienced in the use of JIRA - Creating and assigning tickets
  • Comfortable in the use of Google Suite: Docs, Drive, Sheets, Slides and HangOuts
  • Undergraduate degree in: Business Information Systems, Business Management, Computer Science or related field of study.
  • PMP Certification preferred.

Company DescriptionIT Professional Services Firm focused on Information Communications Technologies -

items.content:
Enrollment Director at StudyPoint

Remote

REMOTE

ENROLLMENT TEAM

FULL-TIME

Who We Are

StudyPoint is a national leader in the private tutoring industry. We are actively seeking enthusiastic, driven individuals to grow our team.

We’re in the business of helping kids, and we’re exceptionally good at it. Our students see dramatic gains in their academic and standardized test results, and our employees enjoy the rewards of growing a mission driven, values based, and entrepreneurial company. We’ve been selected to the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest growing companies in America eight times, and were the list’s #1 fastest growing tutoring company. We’ve also been awarded the Boston Business Journal Pacesetters Award three times, which recognizes the fastest growing companies in Massachusetts. We are a two-time winner of the 50 Most Engaged Workplaces award along with Zappos, Disney, and others. We are privately owned and profitable.

Join a rising star in the education world and a leader in the for-profit education community!

Position Description

StudyPoint provides a unique service to families across the country: one-on-one, individualized tutoring with access to a proven curriculum and a national network of support. Members of our Enrollment Team work as an inside sales consultant, helping families determine which program and tutor is right for them, all while relaying the value of our services. We are looking for highly motivated individuals excited to sell programs that meet families’ needs while exceeding their expectations.

Responsibilities

  • Grow the business by meeting and exceeding monthly sales goals, achieved by enrolling families in StudyPoint’s academic and test preparation programs.
  • Field calls nationally from families looking to enroll students in our programs.
  • Employ a consultative phone sales approach to determine the individual needs of families and students.
  • Match tutors with students based on personality, interests, and skill level across 20 markets throughout the US.
  • Follow up with families who express interest in our programs using email, outbound phone calls, and other methods of communication.
  • Achieve data-driven goals in the metrics of outbound calls, total talk time, inbound calls, and conversion rates.
  • Collaborate with team members responsible for servicing programs and hiring tutors to maximize potential of enrolling more families.

Qualifications

  • Excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to work with many types of people.
  • Excitement around closing the deal and helping families achieve the best possible solution for their child.
  • Ability to multitask and handle a high volume of calls and emails.
  • Careful attention to detail and ability to quickly process verbal and written information.
  • Willingness to work in a constantly changing environment and learn new systems.
  • Willingness to do 20-50 outbound calls and 3-4 hours of phone time per day
  • Proficiency with Microsoft Office and experience working with a CRM database.
  • Excitement to take on increasing responsibility and grow within the company.
  • Experience working in a small, entrepreneurial environment a plus.
  • Previous sales experience a plus.
  • Work schedule of 9:00 AM – 6:00 PM, M – F and some Saturdays during January, February, July & August. Willingness to put in extra hours where needed during busiest seasons (winter & summer).
  • Bachelor’s degree required.Master’s degree a plus.
  • Access to a dedicated home office, including high-speed internet connection. We provide all of the technology you need.

Benefits

  • Competitive salary with optional performance-based commission plans, paid monthly.
  • Generous leave policy, including paid time off and sick days.
  • One paid day a year to volunteer with an organization of your choice.
  • Health coverage and dental option.
  • 401k option.
  • Work from home.
Apply for job

Mumbai, Remote · Full Time

uFaber is a well funded edutech startup, founded by serial entrepreneurs from IIT Bombay. Technology has changed almost every aspect of our life but the way we learn is still the same. We know that we have chosen a very complex and difficult problem to solve but if problem is not challenging, whats the fun! We are building a team of super smart and high IQ people who have the capabilities to make products that can create mass impact. Job Description

KRAs

In a growth stage start-up you would be often surprised to know how much and how fast you can work. This is how your initial days might look like

The only recent innovation is around making the calendar view prettier and more useful to the owner. Read More

At FreeBusy we Do Epic Sh*t! We are bringing to the 21st century group scheduling which is a necessity for how we all get stuff done. The way we interact with email has evolved somewhat in the last 20 years, but calendars are stuck in the 90s. The only recent innovation is around making the calendar view prettier and more useful to the owner.

The main reason for which we plan our day is because time is the most important commodity in the world. Calendars today are good for recording our daily agenda, but they are terrible at coordinating time with others. We’re focusing on coordinating daily life because that’s where tons of value can be added. Join us!

Applied
Apply to FreeBusy
Add a message to FreeBusy
Apply

Job Description

We are looking for a fellow colleague and partner who is excited about combining systems programming with NLP, and machine learning to automate one of the most annoying task professionals have to: endless back-and-forth to schedule meetings.

We proved product/market fit with our MVP and are getting paid for our product. We'd like to formalize our software development practices and accelerate development. We are building a distributed team and you can work remotely if you wish.

Skills
Javascript, Programming, C#, DevOps
Compensation
$50K–$100K
5.0%–10.0%
Visa Sponsorship
Not available
Applied
Apply Now
Add a message to FreeBusy
Apply

What We're Building

Calendar usage grew tremendously in the past few years fueled by adoption of cloud services and mobile devices. Unfortunately, appointments are spread across many services and we are still wasting a lot of time in back-and-forth emails or phone calls. It's often impossible to share real-time availability with others because Outlook and Google Calendar don't work cross-company.

FreeBusy is a scheduling assistant powered by A.I. to coordinate meetings 10x faster with contacts inside and outside your company. You can interact with FreeBusy on the web, smartphone, and desktop, using voice, chat, and email. FreeBusy
works with existing calendars (Google, Office 365, Exchange, iCloud, Outlook.com, etc.) and you can link as many as you have (work, personal, school). Easily share unified availability with business contacts whether they use FreeBusy or not.

Our current focus is to increase enterprise agility when scheduling meetings cross-company. Watch our story https://youtu.be/HobWYI-QYQM

Job description

CircleCI is looking for a technology leader who brings exceptional management and technical skills to our growing team of backend developers. The back end team is currently building out our microservices infrastructure, and we are looking for a leader well versed in distributed systems and functional programming to guide the team as we scale.  In this role you will challenge and grow our engineers with the individual in mind. Your primary focus is your team and the people in it, and we expect you to build a great culture with diversity as a core value.   We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better product for our users. 

This role can be based out of our San Francisco, CA headquarters, our Toronto, Canada office, or remotely

CircleCI is the best platform for software teams looking to rapidly build quality projects, at scale. Our intelligent continuous integration and delivery tools are simple yet powerful. Our aim is to provide the wisdom of a connected development ecosystem to every team member making technology decisions.  

We run 7M+ builds a month on our platform for companies like Spotify, Kickstarter, Sony, and Coinbase. Over 25,000 organizations and 300,000 developers actively build, test, and deploy on CircleCI.  We’ve raised $59.5M in venture capital from Industry Ventures, Top Tier Capital, Scale Venture Partners, DFJ, Harrison Metal Capital, and Baseline Ventures.  

We care deeply about diversity and inclusivity. We’re hiring at all experience levels, and seek talented teammates from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences who are equally committed to cultivating a work environment of respect and kindness. We carefully consider every applicant that takes the time to apply.

items.content:
Technical Partner Manager

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Giant Swarm GmbH | Cologne, Germany

Remote details

Office Location: Cologne, Germany. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Visa Sponsorship: Yes
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

amazon-web-services
go
kubernetes
azure

Job description

  • Apply Using LinkedIn

We are looking for our first Technical Partner Manager

Your Job

You take care to further developing our existing partnerships with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and Microsoft. Your main responsibility is to drive new opportunities and business from these partnerships and ensure that our partners are always informed, aligned and happy. It’s all about communication :) To be concrete, this could be:

  • You doing briefings with partners on Giant Swarm’s Solution (discovery calls with Account Managers and Cloud Solution Architects) and organizing technical workshops. (You wouldn‘t be alone, you’d work with the Giant Swarm team!)
  • You take care of technical partner integration and solutions. If necessary, you’ll have an eye on contracts, timelines and requirements.
  • You work very closely with Sales and Marketing. You drive partners sales and partner marketing activities (e.g. at partner events) and of course, you represent Giant Swarm there.
  • You dive deep into our ecosystem and bring new partners into the network

Requirements

  • You have relevant working experience (marketing, inbound sales, communications) in a technical (StartUp) company.
  • You can explain to us why Microservices and Kubernetes are ‘changing the game.”
  • ‘Getting things done’ in an important part of your job.
  • You’re fluent in German and English.
  • You are empathic. Every partner organization has its own structures and processes. You need to get into them, to get the best out for Giant Swarm.

Why we think this position is worth applying (challenge us!)

  • Impact, Impact, Impact! We are currently an organization with 24 people (located in 13 countries) on the team and every new team member changes the team. This is great! People who know things we don’t are highly welcome.
  • “It's better to ask forgiveness than permission” (Paolini) - sure, it’s not 100% like this, but we have a strong culture of failure which is part of our agile mindset. We don’t do things written in stone. You can try things out!
  • We play a key-role in our customers digital transformation. We have partnered up with AWS and Microsoft to provide our solution on their cloud platforms - more will follow.
  • We serve some of Europe's leading organizations and are talking to many more.

We are not hiring job descriptions. We hire humans. :) We welcome applications from everybody, regardless ethnic or national origin, religion, gender identity, sexual orientation or age.



Interested? Questions? Coffee? Ask Anna. You want to apply directly, just hit https://giantswarm.breezy.hr/p/68f10effde73-partner-manager

Apply now

About Giant Swarm GmbH

WHY US?

We would like to give you a glimpse on how working with us will be like:

Self-organization

Creative work needs freedom and openness. We encourage you to do your work wherever and whenever you want. We expect passion and encourage sustainability. If you need rest, take it. We don't count holidays - we count outcome.

Teamwork 

Our ambitious goals are only achievable as a team. Everybody’s input is highly welcome and appreciated. Although sometimes rules and processes are necessary, we try to keep them as lean as possible. Always question the status quo and find new ways of collaboration and team work.

Learning

Learning is mandatory and fun at the same time. If you realize you want to expand your knowledge in a specific area, we support you with conferences, books etc.

Basics 

We offer fair (transparent and open) salaries with benefits like choosing your own laptop, jobticket, coffee flat, mate etc.. And you will participate in our stock options program. Currently our team members have more children than we are employees. So family friendliness is a must. We base our teamwork on trust and appreciation.  

Benefits

  • unlimited holidays
  • fair and transparent open salaries
  • familiy friendlyness is a must
  • jobticket
  • choose the time you want to work
  • choose the devices you want to work with
  • remote work possible

Head of Engineering

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Customer Data Platform, Data & Analytics, Mobile Analytics
Company size: 11-50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Snowplow Analytics Ltd | London, UK

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+00:00) London +/- 4 hours
Office Location: London, UK. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

cloud
data
scala
scalability

Job description

Head of Engineering

Ideally located in London, Berlin or Amsterdam (open to other locations)

At Snowplow, we are on a mission to empower people to differentiate with data. We provide both the technology and services to enable our customers to not only take control of their data, but allow them to do amazing things with that control.

As part of that effort, we're changing the way that people do digital analytics by moving companies away from a one-size-fits-all mindset and enabling them to collect and own their data themselves.

The Opportunity

Following rapid company growth over the last 12 months, we’re now looking for a Head of Engineering to join us and lead, guide & support our fully-remote engineering team through the next phases of growth. Though the team is still relatively small, they’re already dealing with hugely complex challenges spanning across product, data engineering, cloud architecture, automation and much more.

The role will comprise of 3 key parts:

  • People Management

We have a talented & diverse team of engineers - it will be your job to coach & mentor them, to ensure their personal development is being looked after and to continue to hire people that are not only strong technically, but also closely align with our company culture (wherever they may be located).  

  • Growth

Snowplow’s growth plans are ambitious and a large part of the role will be focused around scaling the technology and coming up with creative ways to overcome obstacles. Our Head of Engineering should be at the forefront of technical innovation, able to prioritise with ease and confident making difficult decisions. We’re looking for someone forward-thinking, who is able to deliver great results now, while also looking ahead at the next hurdle.

  • Technical Excellence

We want to build the possible product and in order to do so, we require technical expertise. We expect our Head of Engineering to do things right and to instil this in the entire team. Best practices, consistent performance and outstanding delivery.

The role is unique, the challenges are complex and the team is diverse. We’re looking for someone who takes all of this and is excited about solving those challenges, and continuing to build a high-performing engineering team at Snowplow.

Things you’ll be doing:

  • Own and operate the Agile processes that we are running
  • Conduct regular 1:1s, champion personal development and hire awesome talent
  • Focus on automation and scaling our current technology
  • Hold the team to high standards and deliver outstanding results
  • Work closely with Product & Engineering to shape how our product is being developed, delivered & refined
  • Improve efficiency & stability
  • Lead with authority, positivity and by example

We’d love to hear from you if:

  • You have experience of working in an engineering management or leadership position looking after multiple squads
  • You have worked with remote teams and are comfortable heading up a geographically distributed team
  • You have a background in one or more of the following:
    • Building SaaS & Web Apps
    • Data Engineering
    • Microservices or Cloud Architecture
  • You exude technical leadership & authoritativeness while also fostering an environment of openness & respect
  • The idea of growing an engineering team in a fast-paced startup excites you
  • You have experience scaling technology
  • You inspire and motivate those around you
  • You’re confident making difficult decisions and navigating change

What you’ll get in return:

  • A competitive package, including share options
  • 25 days of holiday a year (plus bank holidays)
  • Freedom to work wherever suits you best
  • Two fantastic company Away-Weeks in a different European city each year (the last one was in Milan in May 2018)
  • Work alongside a supportive and talented team
  • Grow and develop in a fast-moving, collaborative organisation
  • MacBook Pro
  • Enjoy fun events in and around London organised by our Cultural Work Committee
  • Improve your existing skills or mentor more junior developers in our Software Development Guild
  • Convenient location in central London (Shoreditch)
  • Continuous supply of Pact coffee
Apply now

Benefits

  • A competitive package, including share options
  • MacBook Pro
  • 25 days holiday plus bank holidays
  • Freedom to work wherever suits you best
  • Flexible working hours
  • Two fantastic company Away Weeks a year (last one was in Milan)
  • Convenient Shoreditch office location
  • Regular fun events organised by our Cultural Works Committee
  • Improve coding skills with our Software Development Guild
  • Regular meetups/team offsites

Job description

We’re looking for an experienced Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master to oversee multiple products from initial requirements gathering through acceptance testing while facilitating adherence to an agile methodology. Specifically, the Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master will:

  • Coordinate and facilitate daily stand-ups, project planning and estimation, retrospectives, backlog grooming, release planning, stakeholder demos and other Scrum-related ceremonies. 
  • Implement and foster a lean environment where agile principles create a predictable, priority-driven culture which continuously delivers more value to customers in shorter iterations. 
  • Actively manage issues and sprints to ensure reliable delivery of sprint goals and deliverables across multiple projects and teams. 
  • Maintain desired sprint velocity and hold participants accountable for their responsibilities to ensure timely delivery of software releases. 
  • Monitor and report project KPI's including code quality, velocity, productivity, etc.
  • Own and swiftly break down impediments that prevent things from moving forward. 
  • Assist Product Owner as needed with backlog maintenance, internal and external communication, improving transparency, and disseminating information.

Qualifications:

  • 2+ years experience in a Technical Project Manager – Scrum Master role within a SaaS or enterprise software company practicing agile software development
  • Fluency in Atlassian Suite 
  • Experience managing team members in remote locations
  • Intuition to know when to challenge teams and when to get out of the way
  • Ardent desire to continually improve the agile process 
  • Thrive in a fast-paced, growing company, where scrappy solutions and rapid experiments mobilize innovation 
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills to create, and maintain, focus on key outcomes
  • “Can do” attitude, team player, fun, energetic personality, works well under pressure
  • Genuine passion to improve the real estate industry
Apply now

About Jovio

Jovio is a new kind of real estate brokerage taking a transcendent approach to homeownership and real estate transactions. From streamlined brokerage services to empowering products and tools, Jovio is architecting tomorrow’s real estate marketplace.

Benefits

items.content:
Engineering Manager, Studio (Remote)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Manager
Industry: Collaboration Tools, Computer Software, Design
Company size: 201-500 people
Company type: Private
Company: InVisionApp | No office location

Technologies

user-interface
design
user-experience

Job description

You are someone who loves building high performing teams. You believe that the foundations of a really good team are a clear vision, engaged and talented engineers, just enough process, fast and effective decision-making, and excellent communication.  You’re never satisfied and are always looking for ways to make things better and to deliver faster with higher reliability. You care deeply about the work that you do and the people who are doing it. You practice the leader-leader model. You love building great products and working with awesome people.

At InVision, we are creating the world's leading product design experiences through powerful design and prototyping tools.  We are building InVision Studio to be the world’s most powerful screen design tool. But in many ways, that’s just the beginning.  We intend for Studio to be a platform upon which a massive ecosystem of creative people can solve problems we never even imagined. Through this platform we will be enabling a powerful ecosystem of plugins and applications that enable designers and more to achieve their goals.  As an Engineering Manager on the Studio Marketplace, your team will build the UI and infrastructure that allows developers and partners to share their unique additions to the Studio ecosystem.

There are a number of reasons you really want to be an Engineering Manager on this team.  You will have the opportunity to work with a super talented, engaged engineers who love what they do.  You will work with an experienced leadership team that has successfully grown and mentored managers. You’ll be part of a peer group that is supportive and always learning.

As an Engineering Manager, you will:

  • Be accountable for your team’s delivery and execution on projects and operation of services.
  • Lead and grow the engineers on your team through coaching and mentoring, regular reviews, and one-on-ones.
  • Manage projects through effective planning, communication of status, and coordination of activities within your team and across teams.
  • Continuously improve your team’s processes.

A great candidate is someone who is:

  • Experienced in mentoring and coaching engineers.
  • Experienced in delivering complex projects quickly and with a focus on quality and reliability.
  • Process-oriented but hates bureaucracy. Experienced with Agile and/or Lean.
  • Good at getting things done with minimal oversight while maintaining good information flow.
  • Experienced hiring good engineers who add to the strengths of the team.
  • Balances good strategic vision with tactical execution.

If this sounds like you, please let us know in a cover letter why you think this is a perfect fit for you.

Get to Know Us:

InVision is the Digital Product Design platform used to make the world’s best customer experiences. We provide design tools and educational resources for teams to navigate every stage of the product design process, from ideation to development.Today, more than 3.5 million people use InVision to create a repeatable and streamlined design workflow; rapidly design and prototype products before writing code, and collaborate across their entire organization. That includes more than 80 percent of the Fortune 100, and organizations like Airbnb, Amazon, HBO, Netflix, Slack, Starbucks and Uber, who are now able to design better products, faster.InVision is a fully distributed company with employees in 25 countries around the world. The company has raised more than $235 million in funding from leading investors including Accel, ICONIQ, FirstMark, Tiger Global, Battery Ventures, and Spark Capital. Visit us at InVisionApp.com and InVisionApp.com/blog.
Apply now

Benefits

  • Premium Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Flexible time off policy
  • Remote, work from home
  • Gym memebership
  • unlimited Starbucks
  • unlimited Amazon books

Lead Software Developer / Technical Project Manager

About this job

Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

c#
api
typescript
amazon-web-services
geolocation

Job description

100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US.  Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). 

Who We Need: We are looking for talented software developers to act as lead developers in a customer facing, technical project manager role.  Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer.  We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and examples come together to make both the UI components and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use.

Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities.  You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application.

Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role:

  1. Smart & High Energy Engineer - We work at a very fast pace on cutting edge hard problems and we need people who can keep up.   We need people who really love producing results for customers and who enjoy programming and exhibit the energy and creativity that comes from being fully engaged in the technical side of what we do.
  2. Strong Software Development background - This job is definitely NOT for non technical project managers. Recent, hands-on experience coding both server side (C#) and client side (JavaScript) are strongly suggested, and 5+ years work experience as a professional programmer is required.  
  3. Experience Wireframing UI & Designing APIs - You do not have to have strong artistic skills, but you should be comfortable not only spec-ing out UI wireframes but also designing the supporting technical web service API’s and/or client side component API’s.
  4. Technical Project Management:  You should be highly organized with a strong history in either technical project management or as the lead developer for complex software development projects.  
  5. Customer Facing: comfortable meeting with sophisticated customers and managing expectations on large high value projects.
Apply now

About MapLarge

MapLarge provides Big Data Analytics and Visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient.  The MapLarge API provides real time geospatial and predictive analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly query and visualize data on any desktop, mobile or tablet device.  All of our UI components are re-usable, data driven, event driven, API powered (client and server side), scriptable, re-configurable, savable, deep linkable, shareable etc.  We also have editor components, and data visualization wizards that allow non-technical users to import, automatically visualize data patterns (with sensible defaults that “just work”), conduct predictive analysis and also re-configure more advanced detailed settings with “what you see is what you get” editor tools.

Benefits

  • Flexible Hours
  • No Commute (work from home 100%)
  • Technically Excellent A+ Team solving very hard interesting problems
  • Friendly People - Postitive attitude is our #1 criteria
  • 401k
  • We like all kinds of people
  • Family Friendly
  • Top Notch Health Care
  • Cutting Edge Tech

Cotiviti Labs Functional Programming Developer

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Healthcare, Retail Analytics
Company size: 1k-5k people
Company type: Public
Company: Cotiviti | Atlanta, GA

Remote details

Office Location: Atlanta, GA. Employees can also work full time from this office.

Technologies

scala
java
functional-programming
hadoop
hazelcast

Job description

Developers with the Cotiviti Labs team are responsible for working with a global team of medical doctors and business experts to create break-through solutions for incredibly difficult problems. We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies game-changing solutions. In 2017, we found $3.2B in savings for our clients in 2017 to spend on better health care for their members. 

We use a combination of innovative and proven technologies to put game-changing solutions into production as quickly as possible. Our solutions are scalable, elastic, concurrent, parallel, and deliver results to our clients in real-time.  We are a functional programming shop but are willing to use the best technologies to get into production quickly.  Our DevOps team members have created a sophisticated ChatOps infrastructure that supports everything from deployments, to releases, to provisioning new clients. Our continuous integration and build facilities are world class.

Take our online coding test to get the process started!

REQUIREMENTS:

  • A burning desire to see your work in production
  • A passion for and experience with functional programming languages (Scala, Haskell, Erlang, Clojure, Java 8)
    • Experience with Scalaz/Cats is a plus
    • Purescript/Elm/Ghcjs is a plus
  • A passion for and experience with concurrent and parallel development
  • A deep understanding of Reactive Architectures
  • Desire and passion to learn new concepts and software
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving ability
  • Strong mathematical skills
  • Professional with ability to properly handle confidential information
  • Ability to work independently and in a team environment
  • We are a diverse, multi-cultural global team so you must have excellent written and verbal English skills. Fluency in Hindi, Russian, or Telegu is a plus.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years’ experience in advanced development environments delivering production solutions
  • Degree in computer science (Masters degree is a plus)
  • 95% or higher on our online Scala coding test.
  • Creativity and critical thinking
  • Ability to work independently as well as collaborate as a team

JOB DEMANDS:

  • Must be able to sit and use a computer keyboard for extended periods of time
  • After hours/weekend work required where necessary for major deliverables/deadlines (not consistent)
  • Must have flexibility and willingness to participate in the work processes of an international organization, including conference calls scheduled to accommodate global time zones.
  • Mastery of Cards Against Humanity

KEY CONSTITUENTS:

  • VP of Innovation
  • Chief Operations Officer
  • Chief Digital Officer
Apply now

About Cotiviti

The Cotiviti Labs team is the advanced research and development arm of Cotiviti Holdings, Inc. (NYSE: COTV), a leading provider of analytics-driven payment accuracy solutions primarily focused on the healthcare industry. We work with data from billions of health care interactions that occur every day between doctors and patients and convert that data into a rich web of relationships that we then mine for patterns. Each pattern is translated into a solution that helps our clients achieve a superior level of payment accuracy. Joining our team will provide you with a rewarding opportunity to influence healthcare efficiency and effectiveness by discovering and deploying new Cotiviti solutions.

The Cotiviti Labs team has a flat organizational structure so people on this team have no direct managers, are responsible for their own work assignments, and will receive and give quarterly 360 reviews from their peers. We have no deadlines, only a requirement to move as fast as humanly possible and make every minute count. To thrive in this environment team member must have a passion for computer science, technology, innovation, and delivery.

We value teamwork above everything. We succeed together as a team and are accountable to each other for that success. Though we are scattered across the world we regularly get together to have fun. If you are looking for such a tribe apply now.

Learn more about our team by reading our handbook!

Benefits

  • Close to the Marta!
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Remote work available
  • Have a big impact on healthcare
  • Work with an amazing team
  • Use powerful technologies
  • Tuition Reimbersement
  • Flexible work schedule

Job Description

We are seeking an experienced sales leader to effectively drive IntellaSphere’s sales activities in order to maximize customer/subscriber acquisition. We’re looking for a highly motivated, hands-on sales rock star, who has broad experience growing sales with B2B SaaS-based software and/or a Digital Marketing Agency (preferably experience with both).

Our business is ready to take flight – so we are looking for someone who moves fast, is nimble, comfortable with digital marketing solutions, and has a strong desire to drive revenue and sales to the next level and be part of a winning team.

Job description

• Quickly learn, understand and be able to pitch IntellaSphere’s Integrated Marketing System.
• Create, communicate and execute on an effective sales approach and sales plan.
• Close sales of our full service marketing offering and help drive trial signups of our DIY SaaS-service offering.
• Manage all steps of the sales process / sales pipeline, from lead generation to nurturing to closing.

We are a fast-growing startup, recognized as one of the most exciting companies in the publishing space. We're a remote team of 16 and speak 10 languages. Come build the future of this industry with us.

Job Description

#About Reedsy

We’re here to help authors find world-class professionals to create amazing books. Our curated marketplace gathers some of the best freelancers — the likes of Stephen King's designer, Neil Gaiman's editor or Walter Isaacson's publicist.

Using a content marketing-led strategy, we’ve grown to a community of 100,000 authors in just a few short years (while picking up a number of industry awards along the way). Funded by Europe’s top business angels and VCs, we want to make it possible for anyone looking to publish a high-quality book to do it successfully.

Want to help us? Cool, keep reading!

#Job Description
At Reedsy, we are a passionate community of authors and publishing professionals. We love engaging with our community across all social media channels to understand how they’re using our products, to celebrate their projects and generally to just have some fun.

Your role is to grow Reedsy's community. We are looking for someone with a strong interest in the publishing industry, is a native-level English speaker and strives for perfection.

More precisely, here is what you will do:
Social Media
- Planning and producing our social media content: create content for social media channels daily to do the promotion of blog content, promotions, new features and marketing initiatives.
- Build strategy for new campaigns
- Engage with our community and followers in a witty, warm and knowledgable way.
- Grow Reedsy's presence in online author communities.
- Assist in analyzing and reporting on social media and related metrics.

Here's how you can stand out:
- A good dose of ambition, as well as a great sense of humor
- You are fluent in French, Spanish or German.
- You have a previous experience at a publishing company.

#Want to know why you should join us?
Watch this video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ey0FX19eVo&app=desktop

#How to Apply
We currently receive over 30 applications every day and we won't spend any time on generic messages. If you'd like to stand out, make sure that
1) you've done some research about Reedsy and signed up to try the product;
2) you include a well-structured and **concise** message with your application explaining why you find Reedsy interesting and why you'd be a good fit. Show off but not too much :).

What does it feel like working for a company where you are constantly learning?

It feels great and this is what working at AWE feels like every day.

Advancing Women Executives (AWE) is a start-up with the mission to accelerate the careers of women in business to improve the global economy, by providing VP-level and above corporate executive women the opportunity to build cross-functional and cross-industry relationships in a safe, locally-based environment. AWE membership services include events, training, and executive coaching. AWE currently has memberships in San Francisco, Los Angeles, Silicon Valley, New York and Chicago. AWE is based in Los Angeles, CA, but has staff in all other membership cities.

AWE is seeking a highly qualified Regional Director to join our team to be based in the Bay Area and report to the Founder and CEO. The primary responsibility of this role is to sell AWE services to VP-level and above corporate executive women for the purposes of furthering AWE’s mission and generating business revenue.

Responsibilities:
Prospecting and closing new AWE memberships in San Francisco, Silicon Valley, and Los Angeles;
Network and build relationships with the top influencers in corporate America, private equity, venture capital and service industries;
Lead and develop a team of sales and client relations associates;
Executing a sales methodology with an average sales cycle of 6 weeks or less;
Partner with Associate Director of Member Relations to ensure AWE leaders are active and engaged in membership through a consultative sales approach;
Sales forecasting and new business pipeline management;
Strategize about sales and client relations process and services;
Conduct Training Sessions across California locations;
Host bi-annual events and monthly dinners with AWE leaders.

Qualifications
A successful candidate will possess:

True belief in AWE’s mission to significantly improve the number of women in senior management and on board seats;
The spirit to “Be Bold” and fearless in representing AWE, even during its start-up phase;
Spirit of generosity and service;
Intellectual curiosity and drive to problem solve;
Natural ability to connect with people and to be a connector for people;
6+ years transactional sales experience with success negotiating and closing business;
Exceptional ability to immediately establish one's credibility with senior executives;
Willingness to work outside strict job description parameters, thinking creatively about how to provide the highest level of customer/member service and overall business growth;
Excellent written and oral communication skills;
Strong public speaking skills and experience presenting to large groups;
Great sense of humor;
Excellent meeting facilitation skills; ability to conduct 100% phone-based meetings;
Solid understanding of business concepts and ability to quickly learn content terrain;
Ability to diagnose prospect needs and identify relevant resources;
Ability to meet personal and team weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual financial goals;
Solid understanding of business concepts & dynamics for large national and international corporations;
Superior time management, detail orientation and organization skills;
Bachelor's Degree required, MBA preferred.

AWE is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

No Equity

items.content:
People Ops Executive

Company: In Marketing We Trust
Headquarters: Sydney, Australia
https://www.inmarketingwetrust.com.au
We are delighted to announce that we are currently looking for a People Operations Executive to provide comprehensive support to In Marketing We Trust.

The ideal candidate will be seeking a position that will provide them with an opportunity to gain knowledge and experience working in a diverse, remote environment. 

You will be joining a small company that is keen to develop you and help you grow in your career, so this is an exceptional opportunity - you will quickly step up - so bringing with you strong Assistant and Coordinator level skills and experience is essential.

Key Attributes

The successful candidate will have great attention to detail, the ability to multi-task, work well under pressure, have a can-do attitude and most importantly be extremely discreet due to the confidential information they will be privy to.

You have a passion and interest in the ever-changing digital landscape. You will have to spend a lot of time around digital marketing and technical subjects, so it is important to be really proficient and comfortable with digital technology. You will be incredibly organised, proactive and resourceful, and able to work well on a variety of tasks simultaneously.

Remote work hinges on trust between team members and our company, and while this work style is an incredible opportunity, it is not for everyone... In this role you will need to be able to cope with the less glamorous aspects of working virtually as well!

What you’ll bring
  • Passionate and driven about making sure we bring the best talent on board. (candidate experience is really important to us).
  • Being able to put your logical thinking and initiative into practice.
  • Excellent English verbal and written communication is a must have. (other languages are a plus)
  • Proven People Operations experience of working in an international environment and building solid working relationships across different countries, cultures, and time zones.
  • A good understanding of Word, PowerPoint, Google Suite, project management, and remote collaboration tools.
  • Flexible and agile, and able to adapt quickly.
  • Ability to support and collaborate in an inclusive team environment.
  • Creative problem-solving skills, being able to come up with bold ideas and embracing change.
  • Self-driven, organised, calm under pressure, confident and have a great work ethic to complete tasks and succeed.
  • Have the right remote "office" technology in place.

Attributes and behaviours we love to see
  • Ownership of your work
  • Inquisitive
  • Analytical
  • Solution oriented
  • Results orientated
  • Collegiate and supportive
  • A sense of humour

Duration
Part-time as an independent contractor, with potential to go 'full-time' in the future.


What We Offer You
A highly collaborative remote working environment, where teamwork is championed, and ideas shared - you will be someone who is unafraid of contributing ideas and happy to work as part of a remote team and in exchange for your hard work, we can give you an unique opportunity to shape and contribute to a flourishing business to achieve your lifestyle goals.

Apply for this position

If you can see yourself in this remote role and feel you can add to the ongoing success of In Marketing We Trust, then apply now: https://www.inmarketingwetrust.com.au/about/careers/

items.content:
Engineering Manager

Developer
Anywhere in US
Company: Vox Media
Full Time

Overview

Vox Media employees thrive on innovation and change while ambitiously seeking to master their subject areas, hone their craft, and improve their communities. We help smart, talented, creative professionals make a meaningful impact in media, technology and the world around them. The Vox Media house of networks includes industry-leading media forces like SB Nation, Eater, The Verge, Vox, Curbed, Recode, Racked and Polygon, and reaches an audience of hundreds of millions, generating over a billion content views each month.

About the Chorus Teams

The work of editors and creators at Vox Media today cannot effectively be met by tools designed for a decades-old media landscape. You can no longer assume anything about the way visitors are reading and viewing your work, where they encounter it, or what other shapes it might take; creators deserve tools that make the process of reporting, writing, editing, and producing content easier and more approachable. At the same time, our audiences are everywhere, and they look to us for insight through innumerable lenses and at all times. Vox Media’s Chorus teams design and build innovative new tools that facilitate both the work of editors and producers and the experience of devoted audiences.

Our engineering teams are dedicated to cross-disciplinary product thinking and product vision, prizes thoughtful and collaborative work, and is a remote-first organization.

The Role

Engineering Managers at Vox Media are still hands-on but spend the majority of their time focused on making their teams work better. As an engineering manager for the Chorus team, you will prioritize and plan the work of the team in close collaboration with your engineers, the product manager and the designers. You will actively coach engineers on their day-to-day work and their career aspirations, conduct regular 1:1s for your reports, and evaluate their performance quarterly—setting actionable goals that help them grow in the work and move the team and company forward. You will remove obstacles for the team to unblock their work. This role will require you to recruit and hire great talent for the team by being an evangelist for the organization. In addition, you will help shape the direction of our tech stack to address the evolving concerns of newsrooms in a rapidly-shifting media landscape.

What We Expect

You are a thoughtful, talented engineer who has good experience facilitating the work of their colleagues and reports. You have worked in a matrixed product organization, closely-coupled with designers and product managers. You’re a respectful and empathetic teammate who is willing to go the extra mile for others, and you care about helping us create a diverse, inclusive workforce where we respect all and practice empathy at every opportunity. You have some experience managing technical teams and guiding them to success, and you care deeply about the quality of your work and the team’s work.

Working at Vox Media

For more on the things we’re building and problems we’re solving, and what it’s like to work with the Product, Design & Technology teams, see our. In an effort to an provide an inclusive and respectful working environment, all team members adhere to our.

 Product Team blog code of conduct

 This is a permanent, full-time position with excellent benefits—including flexible hours and generous parental leave. Vox Media strives to provide comprehensive healthcare options for our employees and to ensure that our healthcare and other benefits are LGBTQ-inclusive. You’ll be joining a group of focused, hard-working, creative people who are passionate about doing work that’s challenging and fun—and who strive to maintain a healthy work/life balance.

About working at Vox Media:

 Vox Media is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, national origin, protected veteran status, age, or any other status protected by applicable national, federal, state, or local law.

Vox Media is committed to building an inclusive environment for people of all backgrounds and everyone is encouraged to apply.

items.content:
Director of Competitive Intelligence

Marketing
US or Europe
Company: Elastic
Full Time

Overview

At Elastic, we have a simple goal: to solve the world’s data problems with products that delight and inspire. As the company behind the popular open source projects — Elasticsearch, Kibana, Logstash, and Beats — we help people around the world do great things with their data. From stock quotes to Twitter streams, Apache logs to WordPress blogs, our products are extending what’s possible with data, delivering on the promise that good things come from connecting the dots. We unite Elasticians across 30+ countries (and counting!), 18 timezones and 30 different languages into one coherent team, while the broader community spans across over 100 countries.

We are on the lookout for a Director of Competitive Intelligence. This individual will create and continually refine a competitive strategy for our products and how we take them to market. Based on the variety of use cases our technology enables, Elastic competes in a diverse and ever-changing space.  This individual will ensure our Field teams remain informed and armed with the information they need to be successful in the market while also being active in our community and in front of prospects/customers. If you have experience building out competitive strategy for companies in the search, logging, analytics, security, or APM space and you are at your best when you are in front of customers, we’d love to hear from you!

What You Will Do:

You will craft an ongoing competitive program at Elastic and maintain the structure of how to track the various efforts within the program over time. You will collaborate with various internal partners to build external strategies for competitive messaging, including competitive replacement customer stories, technical blogs, battle-cards, etc.

In Addition, You Will:
  • Coordinate all competitive research and enablement efforts
  • Actively track market trends and internal developments to effectively prioritize how we will respond
  • Build in-depth market analyses and hands-on product research vital to keeping our collateral up-to-date
  • Participate in meaningful industry events to stay current
  • Craft relevant and effective competitive messaging and collateral
  • Ideate with sales, product, and engineering teams
  • Lead internal competitive enablement sessions
  • Build subject-matter expertise and credibility necessary to independently assist the sales force on competitive calls
  • Summarize key pain points related to competitive conversations and communicate to the relevant parts of the organization, including engineering

    • Who You Are:

    You are in a competitive-focused role now. You prefer to remain hands-on and technical, yet want the ability to effectively communicate about our technology and opportunities to be in front of diverse audiences. You have ample competitive materials that you authored to show us, too!

    In Addition, You Have:
    • Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g. CS, CSE, EE), relevant work experience, or the ability to be hands-on with our products (maybe you’re self-taught)
    • Direct experience with products and technologies used in search, analytics and big data space and audiences that use those products (developers, IT operations, data science, business analytics)
    • Natural affinity toward uncovering how something works and using your knowledge for higher-level strategic goals
    • Excellent organization and attention-to-detail
    • Excellent spoken and written communication skills
    • Experience organizing and coordinating efforts and programs across large teams
    • Experience generating competitive positioning, messaging, and collateral
    • Experience dealing with performance benchmarks, feature, and price comparisons
    • Experience delivering enablement sessions
    • Hands-on experience across different types of solutions, from various data stores to analytics UIs
    • Comfort working with a highly distributed team

      • Additional Information:
      • Competitive pay based on the work you do here and not your previous salary
      • Stock options
      • Global minimum of 16 weeks of paid parental leave (moms & dads)
      • Generous vacation time and one week of volunteer time off
      • An environment in which you can balance great work with a great life
      • Your age is only a number. It doesn’t matter if you’re just out of college or your children are; we need you for what you can do.
      • Distributed-first company with Elasticians in over 30 countries, spread across 18 time zones, and speaking over 30 languages!

        • Please note some target locations are highlighted below, but all distributed locations in the US or Europe will be considered. This is a work remotely job from your home or local co-working space, unless you live by one of our offices and choose to work from there.

        Target locations: San Francisco, CA; London, UK; New York, NY; Austin, TX; Denver, CO; Amsterdam, The Netherlands

        Elastic is an Equal Employment employer committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action for all applicants and employees. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation. Elastic also makes reasonable accommodations for disabled employees consistent with applicable law.

        To apply for this job please visit the following URL: https://boards.greenhouse.io/elastic/jobs/1282565 →

items.content:
Director of Support Operations

Company: Automattic
Headquarters: San Francisco, CA
https://automattic.com/work-with-us/director-of-support-operations/
We’re looking for an experienced leader to direct the 24/7/360+ operations of our Happiness organization. You’ll work directly with Automattic’s head of support to shepherd our rapidly growing global support team of over 250 Happiness Engineers.

Our support teams help customers across WordPress.com, Jetpack, and WooCommerce over live chat, email, and screen-sharing sessions. You’ll be responsible for helping this 24/7 operation run smoothly and effectively. Most of all you’ll ensure that we’re providing a consistent, responsive, and high-quality support experience for all of our customers.

We’re looking for someone with experience:

  • Leading a large (300+ person) support organization delivering global coverage.
  • Forecasting future support load and planning ahead to keep service levels consistent.
  • Scheduling and maintaining 24/7 coverage across multiple products.
  • Working across product, marketing, and finance teams to understand how support can best serve the business.
  • Defining and reporting upon key metrics that evaluate support’s effectiveness and performance.
  • Developing training and quality assurance flows that provide for a high-quality support experience.

Proficiency with WordPress is nice to have, though not required. Bonus points if you have experience working on a distributed team.

As a part of our globally distributed team, you can live anywhere in the world. Effectiveness in this role will mean occasionally shifting hours across weekends and odd hours to best coordinate with our global team.

We’re serious about growing diversity in the tech industry. We want to build Automattic as an environment where people love their work and show respect and empathy to those with whom we interact. Diversity typically includes, but is not limited to, differences in race, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, political and religious affiliation, socioeconomic background, cultural background, geographic location, disabilities and abilities, relationship status, veteran status, and age. To work on diversity means that we welcome these differences, and strive to increase the visibility of traditionally underrepresented groups. 

Apply for this position

If you’re reading this on a site other than automattic.com please ensure you visit automattic.com/work-with-us for the latest details on applying.

Director Communications // Idagio

Company: Idagio

Tags:
  • PR
  • Communications
  • Media
  • music

    • ABOUT US

    “This startup is set to revolutionize classical music” – Frankfurter Allgemeine Zeitung

    We are a technology company that is driven by the mission to build the world’s best streaming service for classical music lovers. We’re the only service worldwide that is able to offer the specialized search that lovers of this genre want and need. A search that they can’t and won’t get at Spotify, Apple Music or Youtube.

    We are honoured to also work directly with the world’s leading musicians and institutions, including the Vienna Philharmonic, the Philharmonia Orchestra and the Israel Philharmonic.

    IDAGIO is available to music lovers across the globe, but physically we are rooted in Berlin and consider the German-speaking countries our home base, as the world perceives them as the cradle and the center of classical music.

    WHERE YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE

    Classical music connects people the world over, transcending culture, race and generation to inspire and evoke thoughts and emotions in a way that no other artform can. Our vision is to enrich people’s lives through classical music.

    We are a classical music tech company and our mission is a streaming service that caters to the unique depth and complexity of the genre. This results in user experiences that make classical music as easy as never before. We work with all major and specialized record labels and rights holders around the globe and we maintain close personal contacts with the world’s leading musicians and institutions. Ranging from iconic musicians to future stars and from great orchestras such as the Vienna Philharmonic to institutions such as the Lucerne or Verbier Festival.

    IDAGIO is available to music lovers across the globe. Physically we are rooted in Berlin and we consider the German-speaking countries our home base, as the world perceives them as the cradle of classical music.

    We look forward to your application. Please send us a short text on tech and culture and surprise us with your creative storytelling skills. And don’t forget to include your twitter handle.

    As Director Communications you report directly to the CEO and your role is:

    • Strengthen IDAGIO’s brand and reputation through world class communications strategies and state of the art execution
    • Craft exciting stories
    • Find new and unusual ways and get these stories in front of the right audiences
    • Promote and maintain a positive image of IDAGIO, while ensuring strong online and offline brand presence
    • Set objectives and assign tasks and projects to the PR team
    • Get IDAGIO featured in relevant media and platforms
    • Cultivate and maintain relationships with media and influential professionals
    • Arrange interviews and press releases to promote IDAGIO as the leading streaming service for classical music
    • Organize PR events to increase awareness of our company
    • Track media coverage and report on PR campaigns’ results
    • Support marketing team and ensure brand consistency in all advertising efforts

    EXPERIENCE AND PERSONALITY TRAITS WE FIND RELEVANT FOR THIS POSITION

    • 8+ years of relevant work experience in international Public Relations, preferably with a focus on technology and/or culture
    • Passion for technology, culture, and music
    • Solid practical experience on how to implement and run a strategic PR role from scratch
    • Exceptional talent in the areas of creative writing and editing
    • Social media enthusiast and an active contributor on Twitter and other platforms
    • A curious mind and always up to date towards technology and culture
    • Master or Diploma degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism or other relevant fields
    • Open, humorous and enthusiastic personality with strong commitment and a high level of initiative
    • Creative, strategic, and analytical way of thinking and working
    • Willing to travel on a regular basis
    • Great communication and presentation skills with confidence to serve as the company’s spokesperson
    • Excellent English language skills, German is a big plus

    WHAT WE HAVE TO OFFER

    • Enjoy a positive and purpose-driven working atmosphere in our office in Berlin Kreuzberg
    • Contribute directly to the success of our game-changing product
    • Enjoy flexible working hours, occasional remote work and using the tools and hardware of your choice
    • IDAGIO is well funded by renowned investors such as Tengelmann Ventures, Macquarie Capital, and b-to-v
    • A competitive salary and a yearly education budget
    • Sharpen your piano skills on our Steinway Model D, and yes, there is good coffee too
    • We can support you with your Visa process and can answer your questions around relocation. Berlin is a beautiful city with lots to offer.
    Apply for this position

items.content:
Account Manager

Remote (EST/MST Preferred)

full-time

We’re growing quickly and need your help to continue. If you like solving hard problems, can think analytically, and have the ability to receive a half thought out idea and turn it into an insightful deliverable, please keep reading.

Who are we?

BuySellAds helps connect great brands with hard to reach audiences. When Google Cloud wants to reach developers, we do the heavy lifting. We’re an adtech company empowering publishers and advertisers to connect more efficiently.

Don’t let the “adtech” part scare you away: our mission is to help publishers better monetize their sites so they can spend their time focusing on what they care about (their content!) rather than selling ads. We leverage our tech to improve the experience for both sides along the way.

Digg, CodingHorror.com, Pocket, and Dribbble are just some of the sites who we’re able to help make more money - connecting them with advertisers like Adobe, Microsoft, Google, Slack, and HelloSign, who are all able to expand their reach through us. We sell unique native ads that are often not accessible through programmatic exchanges, reaching a tech-savvy influencer audience.

We are a fully distributed/remote team, with 45+ people spread out across 30 cities in 6 countries. We connect weekly through a video stand up and talk constantly through Slack. We empower teammates to contribute meaningful results. We largely work around an EST schedule but are flexible.

Your Responsibilities:
  • Develop strong understanding of BuySellAds media products
  • Work in partnership with the Sales team to understand client objectives and needs
  • Assist the lifecycle of a campaign from a sales conversation to a live, successful campaign
  • Continually be in the know on our buyer campaigns and analyze for opportunities for improvement alongside sales representatives
  • Assist in finding resolutions to issues
  • Keep a pulse on all live campaigns for proper serving, click through action, and conversion events
  • Assist advertisers with their reporting needs
  • Obtain creative/3rd party tags and assist in delivery or creation when needed
The Ideal Candidate:
  • Obsessively checks emails and replies at an alarming rate
  • Is excited at the opportunity to help marketers achieve complex goals
  • Has experience in the advertising industry
  • Familiarity with different online advertising pricing structures (CPC, CPM, CPA, etc.)
  • Is organized and structured but is not fazed by an out of the box request
  • Has the ability to work independently, consistently producing meaningful results

  • Client-focused mindset with a passion for using data and analytics to drive business results

items.title: Head of Brand/Brand Lead
items.content:
We are looking for a Head of Brand to join our Brand and Creative team. Reporting to our VP - Brand & Creative you’ll act as a brand leader across the business to ensure that every campaign that we launch is on-brand, leading edge and coordinated to drive effectiveness across paid, owned and earned channels.

This is a great opportunity for someone who is excited by the idea of working for a fast growth start-up and who comes from a background working creatively across marketing, social media and design in a fast-paced startup or leading agency.

THE ROLE

In this role you’ll work across paid, owned and earned channels including:

Creative production
-Shoot planning and management with art director
-Managing a team, timings and assets created on shoots
-Scheduling external suppliers, location booking, budgeting with VP, Brand

People management
-Content & Copy Editor
-Social Media Associate
-PR agency

Creative trafficking and prioritisation
-Effective brief writing for content, design, marketing and social
-Creative review tracking back to business goals
-Time management and prioritisation of creative work

Campaign creation, timescales and management
-Effective management of brand partners including expectation setting, timeline creation and project management
-Content briefing
-Working with our Editor on content amplification: syndication & bloggers

Social media strategy and oversight
-Including roll-out to international markets
-Setting targets and understanding KPIs/metrics of these channels
-Oversight of engagement rate and growth rate and managing the team to these targets


YOU

-You have experience working creatively across marketing, social media and design in a fast-paced startup or leading agency
-You excel at time management, prioritisation and getting high quality work done at pace
-Not essential, but any creative/shoot production experience is preferred
-You have 2-3 years managing teams in the social, content and creative space balancing inspiration with high expectations and pace
-You are incredibly commercial and can make business cases for work that ladders back to overarching business objectives
-Proficiency in excel, Google docs/sheets/slides, PowerPoint essential
-You’ve delivered commercially successful and beautiful cross-channel campaign work
-You can show case studies of effectiveness of the work you’ve delivered
-You understand key marketing and social metrics and the levers to drive them
-Demonstrating this competence through case studies of your work is essential
-You’re an effective communicator to champion brand work and be an external ambassador for the brand
-Experience in PR a plus
